abstract: Financial Stability Oversight Council votes to seek public comment on a proposed rule that lays out the standards by which some financial companies that are not banks could fall under stricter regulation; new standards and creation of the oversight council stem from the Dodd-Frank financial reform act.
snippet: The Financial Stability Oversight Council voted to seek public comment on a proposed rule that laid out the standards by which some financial companies could fall under stricter regulation.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: The Financial Stability Oversight Council voted to seek public comment on a proposed rule that laid out the standards by which some financial companies could fall under stricter regulation.

headline.main: Fed Oversight of Nonbank Financial Companies Is Weighed
headline.print_headline: Fed Oversight of Nonbanks Is Weighed
headline.seo: Fed Oversight of Nonbanks Is Weighed
